info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued August 10 at 6:29PM CDT until August 10 at 7:00PM CDT by NWS Midland-Odessa
info.description: The National Weather Service in Midland has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... East central Scurry County in western Texas... * Until 700 PM CDT. * At 628 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Hobbs, or 13 miles east of Snyder, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. A Mesonet 3 miles east of Snyder recorded a 68 mph wind gust. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect considerable tree damage. Wind damage is also likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. * This severe thunderstorm will remain over mainly rural areas of east central Scurry County. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...OBSERVED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
